cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 220 mi SSE of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn NW tonight, then NNWâ€“N on Monday-Tuesday, moving across western Cuba, entering the SE Gulf, then curving NE toward the Florida west coast and eventually inland across GA/SC toward the western Carolinas late week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida west coast (around the Tampa Bay region)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Lower Florida Keys from Seven Mile Bridge southward to Key West, including Dry Tortugas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Grand Cayman; Cuban provinces of Isla de Juventud, Pinar del Rio, Artemisa (Hurricane Warning) and La Habana, Mayabeque, Matanzas (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida west coast, Keys, northern Gulf Coast, Georgia and South Carolina coasts, parts of coastal North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Low (6%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds late Friday; otherwise breezy conditions.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge threat indicated for Wilmington at this time.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of moderate to heavy rain possible late Friday into Saturday as the weakened system or its remnants pass inland to the west of the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough surf and rip currents along the NC beaches; potential minor river flooding inland.
